Service_Name: Wedge Recovery Center_The Recovery and Education Center
Main_Services: ['addiction and recovery', 'outpatient treatment', 'substance abuse counseling', 'medication management', 'mental health care', 'group therapy', 'individual counseling', 'understand mental health', 'community support services', 'peer support', 'spiritual support', 'support groups']
Serving: adults 18+,benefit recipients,all mental health,substance dependency,opioid dependency,alcohol dependency,dual diagnosis,lgbtqia+
Eligibility: Follow the Next Steps to find out if this program has eligibility criteria.
Description: Wedge Recovery Center's Recovery & Education Center (REC) is a day program that combines Outpatient Mental Health Services and Psychiatric Rehabilitation to provide specialized services for individuals who carry a diagnosis of a major mood disorder, a psychotic disorder and/or Borderline Personality Disorder to ensure people in recovery have a safe space to redefine themselves. We offer: - Educational groups- Peer Support- Health, Wellness, and Faith-Based services- Community-based Support and Learning- Individual Therapy and Crisis Support- Group Therapy- Psychiatry (Medication Management)- Co-occurring (Mental Health and Drug & Alcohol) Support- Optional Older Adult ProgramOur ultimate goal is to help a person understand that they are a valued and needed part of society. No person's recovery journey is the same, therefore there is no standard timeframe on REC services. Scheduling is choice-driven; members choose from the ''menu'' of services for the days, times, and activities that best fit their personal needs. The Older Adult Program is open on Saturdays, as well.Once a person completes the REC program they are welcome to transition to our Mental Health Outpatient program. If a person wishes to attend REC, they are able to do so right away; there is no waiting time for starting REC services.We accept Medicaid insurance for all of our REC services.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Philadelphia County, PA.

Description: Youth Advocate Programs offers an IOP program for its youth residents. Description: Rogers Behavioral Health offers evidence-based treatment for adults, children, and adolescents with a variety of mental health and substance use issues.This program provides:- Outpatient treatment- Partial hospitalization care (PHP)- Intensive outpatient care (IOP)- Residential care- Inpatient care- Specialized therapy- Support groupsConditions treated include:- Depression and other mood disorders- Eating disorders- Addiction- Obsessive-Compulsive and anxiety disorders- Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)Services may vary based on your location. To get started, please call or request a screening appointment through the website. You can call 800-767-4411 for Brown Deer, Oconomowoc, and West Allis, and 888-927-2203 for all other locations. The screening will take approximately 30 to 60 minutes to complete. An intake specialist will ask you a series of questions to offer an appropriate recommendation for the program that best suits your needs. For a children under 18, a representative will ask to speak with a parent or guardian. Rogers Behavioral Health offers financial assistance to patients based on income and household size. Please call 262-303-2180 or visit rogersbh.org/what-expect/financing-your-care/financial-assistance-program for more information about how to apply for financial assistance. Medicare is also accepted.

Description:
Mazzoni Center provides a LGBTQ-focused Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP) for alcohol and substance use. This program provides an affirming, safe and respectful treatment opportunity promoting growth and self-discovery.
This program provides:
- Multi-faceted group therapy    
- Aftercare planning
- Individual therapy    
- Medication-Assisted Treatment
- Psychiatric services    
- Peer-based support     
- Peer Recovery support
- Family therapy    
- Relapse prevention    
- Referrals to other Mazzoni Center supportive services

This program is exclusively for LGBTQ people.

We accept most major insurance plans, as well as Medicaid, and some Medicare plans. it is important to understand that all plans vary in coverage. As part of the intake process, they will determine your coverage and cost for IOP. If you are uninsured, we can help determine if you are eligible for special funding, such as Ryan White, to help cover costs. We offer a sliding scale to those who are uninsured and/or not eligible for other coverage.

Description: The Behavioral Wellness Center's Miracles in Progress program provides long-term recovery services for chronically homeless men with substance use disorders and co-occurring mental health issues. Service_Name: Self Help Movement_Halfway House-(2B)
Main_Services: ['addiction and recovery', 'residential treatment', 'substance abuse counseling', 'navigating the system', 'one-on-one support']
Other_Services: addiction & recovery, 12-step, navigating the system, case management, skills & training, interview training, resume development, help find work
Serving: adults, young adults, seniors, male, benefit recipients, substance dependency
Eligibility: This program helps people who are older than 16 years old.
Description:
Our Halfway House is a 24/7 structured community-based residential treatment and rehabilitation facility. This program emphasizes a family atmosphere, encouraging independent growth, personal accountability, and responsible community living.  Our residents continue their individual journey of recovery in a live in/ work out environment, with the support and structure of staff and peers to provide an opportunity for continued success. In addition, the residents of the Halfway House are supported through Case Management and Computer Lab services with resume building, on-line and in-person employment application, interview skills, college/trade school enrollment, money management/budgeting, establishing savings accounts, and addressing legal concerns.  Of greatest importance is maintaining the established in-house recovery support network and gradually extending this into the larger non-treatment community through 12 Step Fellowship meeting attendance, faith-based community worship, social visits with family and sober friends.  In doing so, the goal of the Halfway House is to prepare the individual to successfully and charitably manage the affairs of his daily living without the use of alcohol and other drugs.

We provide:
- Short-term housing
- Sober living
- Case management
- Interview skills
- Resume building
- Help finding work
- 12 step meeting

Self Help Movement accepts BHSI, CBH, Magellan through Bucks, Delaware, Lehigh and Montgomery Counties, Private Insurance and Self Pay.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Philadelphia County, PA.

Description: Housing First Treatment Teams provide support services using the models ``Housing First'' and  ``Assertive Community Treatment''. This program supports chronically homeless persons with behavioral health disorders who have not been able to address their behavioral health and/or drug and alcohol issues or maintain housing through more traditional treatment approaches.This program provides:- Crisis assessment and intervention 24/7- System assessment- Management and treatment- Prescription- Administration documentation and monitoring of medication- Mental health and/or addiction counseling (individual or group)- Activities of daily living instruction- Using public transportation- Assistance accessing benefits (medical, SSI or SSD, food stamps)- Education or employment assistance- Specialized counseling and therapyFor more information about services in Philadelphia County, please call 215-386-3838, ext. 12667. For more information about services in Delaware County, please call 610-328-1306.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Delaware County, PA and Philadelphia County, PA.

Service_Name: Citizens Acting Together Can Help Inc_Packer Community Integrated Recovery Center
Main_Services: ['daily life skills', 'medication management', 'mental health care', 'group therapy', 'substance abuse counseling', 'individual counseling', 'medications for mental health', 'mental health evaluation']
Serving: seniors, benefit recipients, all mental health
Eligibility:
This program helps people who are older than 54 years old.
Must have a present, or a history of a, serious mental illness which includes the following diagnoses by a psychiatrist: schizophrenia, major mood disorder, psychotic disorder, schizoaffective disorder or borderline personality disorder.
Must have a moderate to severe functional impairment in the domains of education, social, vocational, self maintenance related to ethnic/cultural environment.
Members must choose to participate in the program, be stable, absent of any withdrawal symptoms. The person must also be willing to come to the program.
Description: The Packer CIRC program offers outpatient psychiatric services combined with community-oriented psychiatric rehabilitation services for individuals of at least 55 years of age who have a present, or a history of a, serious mental illness.We provide:- Individual counseling- Group counseling- Daily life skills development- Psychiatric evaluations, medication consultation, and medication managementMembers work on skills which will help them achieve a variety of goals ranging from psychiatric symptom reduction to independent living and vocational/educational placement. Our dedicated staff uses a blend of best practices, recovery models, and a person-centered approach that builds coping and socialization proficiency. Services are provided on-site and in a community-based setting.Treatment continues for as long as needed. Cases are reviewed every six months.Citizens Acting Together Can Help accepts Medicaid and Medicare.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Philadelphia County, PA.

Service_Name: Wedge Recovery Center_Outpatient Subsance Abuse Program

Description: Wedge Recovery Center's Outpatient Subsance Abuse Program offers a holistic and individualized approach to addiction and recovery treatment with a shared goal of improving the quality of life of our members.We offer:- Group Therapy- Individual Counseling - Medication Management- Medication-Assisted Treatment- Case ManagementOur outpatient program delivers group twice a week with an individual session once a month. We also offer psych services and medication management for members with mental health diagnoses concurrent with drug and alcohol.We accept all referrals, including self-referrals, for our program. The potential member who is referred for treatment will receive an appointment  within 48 _ 72 hours and at that appointment a comprehensive Bio-Psychosocial Evaluation is completed. The member is scheduled for the appropriate level of care and provided a schedule for treatment and their Counselors name.We accept Medicaid insurance for our outpatient services.

Service_Name: US Department of Veterans Affairs - Veterans Health Administration_Substance Use Disorder Program
Main_Services: ['addiction and recovery', 'outpatient treatment', 'residential treatment', 'substance abuse counseling', 'medications for addiction', 'understand mental health', 'counseling', 'mental health care', 'group therapy', 'family counseling', 'individual counseling', 'medications for mental health', 'mental health evaluation', 'government benefits']
Serving: adults 18+, veterans, homeless, near homeless, benefit recipients, substance dependency, opioid dependency, alcohol dependency, dual diagnosis
Eligibility: If you served in the active military, naval or air service and are separated under any condition other than dishonorable, you may qualify for VA health care benefits. Current and former members of the Reserves or National Guard who were called to active duty (other than for training only) by a federal order and completed the full period for which they were called or ordered to active duty may be eligible for VA health care as well.
Description: VHA Substance Use Disorder Program offers a number of options for all eligible veterans seeking treatment for substance use problems.  Available treatments address all types of problems related to substance use, from unhealthy use of alcohol to life-threatening addictions.This program provides:- First-time screening for alcohol or tobacco use in all care locations- Short outpatient counseling including focus on motivation- Intensive outpatient treatment- Residential (live-in) care- Medically managed detoxification (stopping substance use safely) and services to get stable- Continuing care and relapse prevention- Marriage and family counseling- Self-help groups- Drug substitution therapies and newer medicines to reduce cravingDecisions as to which services are provided and how intense they are will be based on the patient's needs and desires.All veterans are encouraged to enroll in the VA Health Care System. To begin the process, please complete an Application for Health Care Benefits. You can submit the form online, or you may print the form to be mailed or brought to your local VA medical center or clinic.
Coverage: This program covers residents of All US states and territories.

We don't turn anyone away.
